data.title: Flowers for Algernon by Daniel Keyes, First Edition
data.meta_description: Flowers For Algernon by Keyes, Daniel and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Softcover. Condition: Good. First Edition. With more than five million copies sold, Flowers for Algernon is the beloved, classic story of a mentally disabled man whose experimental quest for intelligence mirrors that of Algernon, an extraordinary lab mouse. In poignant diary entries, Charlie tells how a brain operation increases his IQ and changes his life. As the experimental procedure takes effect, Charlie's intelligence expands until it surpasses that of the doctors who engineered his metamorphosis. The experiment seems to be a scientific breakthrough of paramount importance--until Algernon begins his sudden, unexpected deterioration. Will the same happen to Charlie?.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good+ to Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good+. Book Club (BCE/BOMC). BCE #B-13 (1st printing thus). Cover art by Herb Mott. Includes "Flowers for Algernon" by Daniel Keyes; "A Different Purpose" by Kem Bennet; "Ralph Wollstonecraft Hedges: A Memoir" by Ron Goulart; "All you Zombbies-" by Robert A. Heinlein; "Casey Agonistes" by R. M. McKenna; "Eastward Ho!" by William Tenn; "Soul Mate" by Lee Sutton; "What Rough Beast?" by Damon Knight; "Far from Home" by Walter S. Tevis; "Invasion of the Planet of Love" by George P. Elliott; "Dagon" by Avram Davidson; "Pact" by Winston P. Sanders; "No Matter Where You Go" by Joel Townsley Rogers; "The Willow Tree" by Jane Rice; "The Pi Man" by Alfred Bester; "The Man Who Lost the Sea" by Theodore Sturgeon. Minor rubbing, soiling and tanning; minor tear at dj spine heel.

Hardcover. Condition: new. Hardcover. Charlie Gordon, a retarded adult, undergoes a brain operation which dramatically increases his intelligence. Charlie becomes a genius. But can he cope emotionally? Can he develop relationships? And how do the psychiatrists and psychologists view Charlieas a man or as the subject of an experiment like the mouse Algernon? Charlie Gordon, a retarded adult, undergoes a brain operation which dramatically increases his intelligence. Charlie becomes a genius. But can he cope emotionally? Can he develop relationships? And how do the psychiatrists and psychologists view Charlieas a man or as the subject of an experiment like the mouse Algernon? Shipping may be from our UK warehouse or from our Australian or US warehouses, depending on stock availability.

1st Edition Custom made Clamshell Collector's Case. Custom Collector's Clamshell Case for the First Edition of Flowers for Algernon by Daniel Keyes. Superb Custom Fitted Modern Collector's Clamshell Bookcase, No Binding, [Not A Book] HAND-CRAFTED by our conservation team, each box is Gilt-stamped at the spine. The case is finished in rich black Nuba® with a 'sculpted design [after the book's iconic illustrated wrapper] on the side.with Dark Blue Cloth and Velour finished interior. Every TBCL case can be finished in a selection of fine leathers & cloths or Nuba® or a combination of both. Nuba® is a fine, supple & durable covering with a neutral ph that has the feel of velvety soft Italian Nubuck leather. This clamshell is perfectly sized to accommodate your first edition. A Handsome Collector's Custom Case for an important Book. Generally over 100 in-stock titles. Custom orders available upon request. "Book definitely NOT included" When you place your order: Please confirm the actual size of your first edition as sizes may vary with age if covered in mylar. *The text can be altered to remove "signed limited" or other special requests. 1st Edition Custom made Clamshell Collector's Case.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. First Edition. Very Good. Grey cloth, bumped at the edges, some spots of toning on the spine and rear board. Square and firmly bound, clean internally. Keyes' beloved novel of Charlie Gordon who undergoes an operation to increase his intelligence. The short story predecessor received the Hugo Award in 1960 and this novelization received the Nebula Award in 1966.

First Edition. FLOWERS FOR ALGERNON, Creative Education, 1988, first separate and first illustrated edition (with first printing so stated on the copyright page to insure proper identification), as new in like dust-wrapper. Filmed most successfully as CHARLIE. This HUGO winning short story offered here was later lengthened and became a NEBULA winning novel. This copy specially SIGNED by the author. Very scarce thus. 1/2,000 copies of which almost the entire print run was devoured by the library market.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good+. Stated First Edition. A true first edition, bound in grey cloth with blue metallic spinal title and green metallic spinal publisher's logo. Light shelf and edge wear to cloth, 1.5 inchs at top of grey cloth spine stained brown. Jacket is 70% whole, with missing piece from lower front that wraps to rear, and with closed tears. Jacket has been stuck to front and rear boards with resulting residue - from a previous personal collector's library who labeled and possibly glue jackets to boards. RARE in this state, and even more so in this condition. The whole is conservatively graded and appears nicer than graded. Protected in an acid free mylar cover.

Hardcover. Condition: Collectable - Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. First Edition. Near Fine/Near Fine 1st printing 1st ed Harcourt Brace hardback, price-clipped DJ in protective mylar. Highly sought after first edition with jacket by Carl Smith. A discrete code number 'C-4-6' written in pen along lower inner rear flap of jacket, book is beautifully preserved with gentle toning to pages, spine ends a little pushed, tight and unmarked. Quantity Available: 1. Shipped Weight: 1-2 kilos. Category: Science Fiction & Fantasy; ISBN: 0151315108. ISBN/EAN: 9780151315109. The photos provided are of our own book, further photos may be arranged upon request. Inventory No: 085813.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. First edition of the Nebula Award-winning novelization of this short story originally published in 1959, itself winning a hugo. This classic story has been widely taught in schools as well as challenged and banned since its publication, its themes centering on the treatment of the developmentally disabled, man playing God, the influence on family on one's future endeavors, and even sexuality as personal identity. Very good with some soiling and toning to edges of page block and gray cloth boards. Cloth lightly worn at lower corner tips. Jacket shows a couple small closed tears to lower edge and some soiling and smudging, mainly along folds and spine. Original price of $4.95 intact.

Octavo, cloth. First edition. The novel won the 1966 Nebula award; the earlier short story won the 1960 Hugo award. Filmed twice, the first as "Charly" in 1968 starring Cliff Robertson who won an Oscar for the title role, and again in 2000 as "Flowers for Algernon" in a made for TV film. Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-597. Survey of Science Fiction Literature II, pp. 802-06. A fine copy in fine dust jacket with a couple of tiny nicks at edges and a touch of dust soiling along outer front spine fold. A clean, sharp copy overall. (#134550).

First edition. Octavo, cloth. The novel won the 1966 Nebula award; the earlier short story won the 1960 Hugo award. Filmed twice, the first as "Charly" in 1968 starring Cliff Robertson who won an Oscar for the title role, and again in 2000 as "Flowers for Algernon" in a made for TV film. [Reference: Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-597. Survey of Science Fiction Literature II, pp. 802-06]. A fine copy in fine dust jacket with a couple of tiny nicks at edges and a touch of dust soiling along outer front spine fold. A clean, sharp copy overall. (13864).

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. 8vo., 274pp. Beautiful Stated First Edition of this landmark work. bound in gray cloth with spine titles in blue. Square and tight with some softness and a hint of toning to spine ends but quite minor. Pages 89-90 have a are stain, (coffee?), and a couple of additional very small spots to fore-edge. Still a very well-preserved copy. Equally attractive unfaded and unclipped dust jacket, ($4.95), has a touch of wear to the upper rear flap and a miniscule closed tear to the crown which is barely noticeable. Still fresh and bright with no creases, toning or chipping. Made into the terrific1968 film, "Charly", starring Cliff Robertson and Claire Bloom. Laid in is a clipped slip, like from a promotional flyer, signed by the author. A very sharp, collectable copy at a very good price.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. First Edition, First Printing. An attractive dustjacket with light wear to the edges and corners. This original dustjacket has the $4.95 printed price present. The book is in nice condition with minor wear to the boards. The binding is tight and the pages are clean. There is NO writing, marks or bookplates in the book. Overall, a sharp clean copy of this true first edition with the original First issue dustjacket.

Cloth. Condition: Very Good Plus. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. Grey cloth (hard cover), in original mylar protected dust-jacket. True First Edition / First Printing with "First edition" stated on copyright page and $4.95 price on jacket. INSCRIBED and boldly SIGNED by Daniel Keyes on front fly, "Inscribed for my / Student --- / with great pleasure / Best wishes in your new decisions / Daniel Keyes (signed) / Athens, Ohio / May 22, 1967." A nice copy in lightly chipped and worn jacket, book is clean and bright. Overall, a desirable, signed first edition of a modern classic Size: Octavo. Signed by Author.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine +. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. SIGNED twice by author on title page (signature only) and on back of half title page "For Larry Adams with all best wishes Daniel Keyes Athens,Ohio Nov.15,1976". NEAR FINE PLUS hardcover book (faint four inch streak/groove across lower corner front and back boards) & Near Fine DJ (five very small chips, six very small closed tears (all about eighth of inch), spine panel slightly wrinkled, glue residue from sticker at top of DJ flap but not over the original $4.95 price). FIRST EDITION, FIRST PRINTING.Bright clean square tight.Not exlibrary. Not a book club. No underlining.No highlighting. Not a remainder.Not price clipped.Shelf315. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. Great award winning book & DJ in NEAR FINE excellent condition (but DJ price clipped).Shelf 1002 Text clean; book tight; signed by author ( not personalized ) with inscription," My Hugo Award winning story Nebula Award winning novel Daniel Keyes July 4, 1967". Signed at my request when I mailed my first editions to him, he promptly signed and mailed them back. STATED First Edition. A bit of dusting to top edge of paper; very slight wrinkle to DJ spine (wrong kind of mylar on it for years), DJ covered by correct mylar now.Not a book club (BC)copy. No previous owner name, not ex library, not a remainder, smoke free. Signed by Author on Title Page.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. First Edition, First Printing SIGNED by Daniel Keyes on a laid in signature. A fabulous copy of this TRUE FIRST EDITION with the words "First Edition" printed on the copyright page. This original dustjacket has the $4.95 printed price present. The book is in excellent condition. The binding is tight with NO cocking or leaning and the boards are crisp with minor wear. The pages are clean with NO writing, marks or bookplates in the book. A wonderful copy SIGNED by the author in collector's condition. Signed by Author(s).

Octavo, cloth. First edition. The novel won the 1966 Nebula award; the earlier short story won the 1960 Hugo award. Filmed twice, the first as "Charly" in 1968 starring Cliff Robertson who won an Oscar for the title role, and again in 2000 as "Flowers for Algernon" in a made for TV film. Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-597. Survey of Science Fiction Literature II, pp. 802-06. A fine copy in fine dust jacket priced $4.95 on the front flap. A lovely copy. (#172564).

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. Great award winning book & DJ in NEAR FINE excellent condition.Shelf 1002 Text clean; book tight; signed by author ( not personalized ) with inscription," My Hugo Award winning story Nebula Award winning novel Daniel Keyes July 4, 1967". Signed at my request when I mailed my three first editions to him , he signed and promptly mailed them back. Original price of $4.95 on jacket, STATED First Edition. A bit of dusting to top edge of paper; very slight wrinkle to DJ spine (wrong kind of mylar on it for years), DJ covered by correct mylar now.Not a book club (BC)copy. No previous owner name, not ex library, not a remainder, smoke free. Signed by Author on Title Page.

First edition, first printing, advance review copy, with the publisher's slip loosely inserted. "Flowers for Algernon" first appeared in the April 1959 issue of the Magazine of Fantasy & Science Fiction and won the Hugo Award for Best Short Story in 1960. Keyes expanded the story into this book, which was joint winner (with Samuel Delany's Babel-17) of the Nebula Award for Best Novel in 1966. "Flowers", which is often on lists of banned books in the United States and Canada, has been adapted for television, theatre, radio, and as the Academy Award-winning film Charly (1968). Octavo. Original grey cloth, spine lettered in metallic blue with publisher's imprint in metallic green, orange endpapers. With dust jacket. Foot of spine just bumped, ends and corners a little rubbed; a few spots of foxing to spine of unclipped jacket, a few nicks and short closed tears, trivial marks to rear panel: a fine copy in near-fine dust jacket.

First Edition. FLOWERS FOR ALGERNON, Harcourt, Brace & World, 1966, first edition, some slight spotting to the spine as is so often the case with this book, else near fine in like dust-wrapper. HUGO & NEBULA winner. SIGNED by the author. Source book for the muchj loved film CHARLY.

First edition of the author's Hugo and Nebula Award-winning novel, basis for the Oscar award-winning movie adaptation Charly. Octavo, original cloth. Presentation copy, inscribed by the author on the half-title page, "To Linnea Loge a fine writing student, for whom it is a pleasure to inscribe this- Best Wishes Daniel Keyes Athens Ohio, February 3, 1967." Fine in a near fine dust jacket. Jacket design by Carl Smith. Housed in a custom half morocco clamshell box. With more than five million copies sold, Flowers for Algernon is the beloved, classic story of a mentally disabled man whose experimental quest for intelligence mirrors that of Algernon, an extraordinary lab mouse. In poignant diary entries, Charlie tells how a brain operation increases his IQ and changes his life. As a 1959 novella it won a Hugo Award; the 1966 novel-length expansion won a Nebula. The Oscar-winning movie adaptation Charly (1968) also spawned a 1980 Broadway musical.
